intro: Iranecio elbrusensis, commonly known as the Elbrus iranecio, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus Mountains. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
